DOC.brief_summary: Cognitive Intervention to Improve Memory in Heart Failure patients
DOC.brief_title: Cognitive Intervention to Improve Memory in Heart Failure Patients
DOC.detailed_description: A three arm randomized controlled trial of 264 heart failure patients.
DOC.criteria: At least 21 years of age Understands English Has access to a telephone Hears normal conversation For patients with hearing aids, able to wear and hear through headsets Diagnosis of chronic heart failure, stage C, NYHA I, II or III Receiving guideline derived medical therapy Heart failure validated by echocardiography or other method in past 2 years History of drug or alcohol abuse or major psychiatric diagnosis present before the heart failure diagnosis Alzheimer or other dementia diagnosis or central nervous system degenerative disorder Terminal cancer Patients with baseline Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) score of less than 19
